net.sf.javaml.clustering

Class KMeans

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.javaml.clustering.KMeans
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Clusterer

    public class KMeans
extends java.lang.Object
implements Clusterer
    Implements the K-means algorithms as described by Mac Queen in 1967. J. B. MacQueen (1967): "Some Methods for classification and Analysis of Multivariate Observations, Proceedings of 5-th Berkeley Symposium on Mathematical Statistics and Probability", Berkeley, University of California Press, 1:281-297
    Author:
    Thomas Abeel (thomas@abeel.be)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      KMeans()
      Constuct a default K-means clusterer with 100 iterations, 4 clusters, a default random generator and using the Euclidean distance.
      KMeans(int k)
      Constuct a default K-means clusterer with the specified number of clusters, 100 iterations, a default random generator and using the Euclidean distance.
      KMeans(int clusters, int iterations)
      Create a new Simple K-means clusterer with the given number of clusters and iterations.
      KMeans(int clusters, int iterations, DistanceMeasure dm)
      Create a new K-means clusterer with the given number of clusters and iterations.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Dataset[] cluster(Dataset data)
      Execute the KMeans clustering algorithm on the data set that is provided.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • KMeans

        public KMeans()
        Constuct a default K-means clusterer with 100 iterations, 4 clusters, a default random generator and using the Euclidean distance.

      • KMeans

        public KMeans(int k)
        Constuct a default K-means clusterer with the specified number of clusters, 100 iterations, a default random generator and using the Euclidean distance.
        Parameters:
        k - the number of clusters to create

      • KMeans

        public KMeans(int clusters,
      int iterations)
        Create a new Simple K-means clusterer with the given number of clusters and iterations. The internal random generator is a new one based upon the current system time. For the distance we use the Euclidean n-space distance.
        Parameters:
        clusters - the number of clusters
        iterations - the number of iterations

      • KMeans

        public KMeans(int clusters,
      int iterations,
      DistanceMeasure dm)
        Create a new K-means clusterer with the given number of clusters and iterations. Also the Random Generator for the clusterer is given as parameter.
        Parameters:
        clusters - the number of clustesr
        iterations - the number of iterations
        dm - the distance measure to use

    • Method Detail

      • cluster

        public Dataset[] cluster(Dataset data)
        Execute the KMeans clustering algorithm on the data set that is provided.
        Specified by:
        cluster in interface Clusterer
        Parameters:
        data - data set to cluster
        clusters - as an array of Datasets. Each Dataset represents a cluster.
        Returns:
        the different clusters obtained by this clustering algorithm. Each cluster is represented as a separate data set.
